question: Question 1-12/19/2008 Following a scram, the value of the stable reactor period is:

answers.answer: a. infinity, since neutron production has been terminated
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals Handbook, Nuclear Physics and Reactor Theory, Volume

answers.answer: b. about 50 seconds, because the rate of negative reactivity insertion rapidly approaches zero.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals Handbook, Nuclear Physics and Reactor Theory, Volume

answers.answer: c. about -10 seconds, as determined by the rate of decay of the shortest lived delayed neutron precursors.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals Handbook, Nuclear Physics and Reactor Theory, Volume

answers.answer: d. about -80 seconds, as determined by the rate of decay of the longest lived delayed neutron precursors.
answers.feedback: Correct
